events.comment: Remap the controls of each player to be different
Create name tags for each player
Update the position of the name tags
For each player, move the camera and render into the associated screen sprite
After rendering all the players screens, move back the camera to those screens

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: jeremy.leriche22@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RandomColor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create a random color for a scene, an object, or any other color input.
description: Allows you to create a random color.
To use it, go in the text area to set a color and type `RandomColor::CreateRandomColor()`.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a totally random color.
eventsFunctions.name: CreateRandomColor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Quickly remap Behavior controls to different keys.
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a Top-Down behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForTopdown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RenderToSprite
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Renders an object, layer or scene and puts the resulting image into a sprite.
description: Allows rendering (creating an image) of objects, layers and the scene to display in a sprite.
This allows to make optimizations by transforming the resulting image of a shape painter into a faster sprite, or to make viewports/cameras.

eventsFunctions.description: Renders an object and puts the rendered image into a sprite object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Render an object into a sprite
eventsFunctions.name: RenderObject

inlineCode: // Reset position so that it is not offscreen while rendering

const { width, height, x, y } = source.getLocalBounds();

description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: TiledUnitsBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterBar

eventsFunctions.description: the value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Value

events.comment: The value is clamped by the behavior. This is why Object.Value() is used instead of Value directly.

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is empty.
eventsFunctions.name: IsEmpty

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is full.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFull

propertyDescriptors.description: It's used to detect a change at hot reload.
propertyDescriptors.name: PreviousInitialValue

propertyDescriptors.label: Unit width
propertyDescriptors.description: How much pixels to show for a value of 1.

propertyDescriptors.description: Only used by the scene editor.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpeedRestrictions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Limit the maximum movement and rotation speed of an object from forces or the physics behavior.
description: Limit the maximum movement and rotation speed of an object from forces or the physics behavior.
- Add the behavior that matches the method used to move the object (forces or physics)
- Set the maximum speed value in the behavior properties
- This only affects movement caused by forces or physics behavior
- This may not affect movement caused by other behaviors (platformer, top-down, draggable, etc)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum speed an object will move from (non-physics) forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxMovementSpeed_Forces

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum speed an object will move from physics forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxMovementSpeed_Physics

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Limit the maximum rotation speed of an object from physics forces.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MaxRotationSpeed_Physics
